results.title: Egypt: a new horizon
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Alfred Wagg Pictures
results.brief_description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.
results.description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.

results.title: Egypt and the Nile
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Donald G. Hoffman
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of Egypt and the Nile Valley as seen against its historical background. Emphasises the importance of the Nile River in the whole pattern of Egyptian life. Includes scenes of an ancient temple to the sun god at Abu Simbel, the dam at Aswan, the delta of the Nile, the Suez Canal, and the cities of Asyut, Cairo, and Alexandria.

results.title: Egretta
results.brief_description: A life history of the four species of egrets commonly found in Australia, the white egret, the great egret, the white crane and the white heron.

results.title: Ego development: the core of a healthy personality(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Arthur M Kaye
results.brief_description: Analyses the establishment of ego qualities and the setting and achievement of goals in very young children. Proper resolution of the conflict between biological, psychic, and societal demands leads to the establishment of a healthy ego

results.title: Eggs
results.brief_description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.

Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.

results.title: Egghead's robot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Children's Film and Television, Cecil Musk and Milo Lewis
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-alike robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G

results.title: Egg-ceptional
results.brief_description: A deceptively simple film about an egg who doesn’t fit. Superb animation details the various stages of the production process where the egg who is ‘different’ fails to meet the required specifications. A film that operates on a number of levels ranging from lower primary concepts of colour, number and size to the more abstract concepts of conformity, individual differences, desire for acceptance, etc.

results.title: Efftee entertainers
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: This film provides footage of the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films. These long forgotten ‘shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the 1930’s. Footage includes famous local comics, singers and dancers: Stan Ray, George Moon, Minnie Love and Keith Desmond.

results.title: Efftee's Australia
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the documentary output of Australia’s first talkie studio - Frank Thring senior’s Melbourne based Efftee Productions. All of these “shorts” have been transferred directly to video from 35 mm nitrate negatives and prints. Rated: G
